contexts.text:
Primary source
In the study of history as an academic discipline , a primary source ( also called original source or evidence ) is an artifact , a document , diary , manuscript , autobiography , a recording , or any other source of information that was created at the time under study . It serves as an original source of information about the topic . Similar definitions can be used in library science , and other areas of scholarship , although different fields have somewhat different definitions . In journalism , a primary source can be a person with direct knowledge of a situation , or a document written by such a person .
contexts.title: Primary source

ml.tokens.model_text: |user|: what is the difference between primary and archaeological sources

contexts.text:
Primary source
A study of cultural history could include fictional sources such as novels or plays . In a broader sense primary sources also include artifacts like photographs , newsreels , coins , paintings or buildings created at the time . Historians may also take archaeological artifacts and oral reports and interviews into consideration . Written sources may be divided into three types .
contexts.title: Primary source

ml.tokens.model_text: |user|: what is the difference between primary and archaeological sources

contexts.text:
Primary source
If a historical text discusses old documents to derive a new historical conclusion , it is considered to be a primary source for the new conclusion . Examples in which a source can be both primary and secondary include an obituary or a survey of several volumes of a journal counting the frequency of articles on a certain topic .
contexts.title: Primary source

ml.tokens.model_text: |user|: what is the difference between primary and archaeological sources

contexts.text:
Primary source
In the humanities , a primary source could be defined as something that was created either during the time period being studied or afterward by individuals reflecting on their involvement in the events of that time . In the social sciences , the definition of a primary source would be expanded to include numerical data that has been gathered to analyze relationships between people , events , and their environment . In the natural sciences , a primary source could be defined as a report of original findings or ideas . These sources often appear in the form of research articles with sections on methods and results . ''
contexts.title: Primary source

messages.original_text: The document does not provide a specific definition or difference between primary and archaeological sources. However, it does mention that primary sources can include artifacts like photographs, newsreels, coins, paintings, or buildings created at the time. Archaeological artifacts are a type of primary source, as they were created at the time under study. Therefore, the difference between primary and archaeological sources would be that all archaeological sources are primary sources, but not all primary sources are archaeological sources.

messages.speaker: agent
messages.text: If you asking about History as an academic discipline, it is based on primary sources can include artifacts, documents, diaries, manuscripts, autobiographies, recordings, or any other source of information that was created at the time under study. They serve as original sources of information about the topic. Examples of primary sources in history include novels or plays, photographs, newsreels, coins, paintings, buildings, archaeological artifacts, oral reports, and interviews. Written sources may be divided into three types: documents such as official reports, speeches, pamphlets, posters, or letters by participants, official election returns, and eyewitness accounts; books, essays, and letters written by intellectuals; and religious texts and descriptions of religious ceremonies and rituals.

contexts.text:
Primary source
In scientific literature , a primary source is the original publication of a scientist 's new data , results and theories . In political history , primary sources are documents such as official reports , speeches , pamphlets , posters , or letters by participants , official election returns and eyewitness accounts . In the history of ideas or intellectual history , the main primary sources are books , essays and letters written by intellectuals ; these intellectuals may include historians , whose books and essays are therefore considered primary sources for the intellectual historian , though they are secondary sources in their own topical fields . In religious history , the primary sources are religious texts and descriptions of religious ceremonies and rituals .
contexts.title: Primary source

contexts.text:
Primary source
History as an academic discipline is based on primary sources , as evaluated by the community of scholars , who report their findings in books , articles and papers . Arthur Marwick says `` Primary sources are absolutely fundamental to history . '' Ideally , a historian will use all available primary sources that were created by the people involved at the time being studied . In practice some sources have been destroyed , while others are not available for research . Perhaps the only eyewitness reports of an event may be memoirs , autobiographies , or oral interviews taken years later . Sometimes the only evidence relating to an event or person in the distant past was written or copied decades or centuries later . Manuscripts that are sources for classical texts can be copies of documents , or fragments of copies of documents . This is a common problem in classical studies , where sometimes only a summary of a book or letter has survived . Potential difficulties with primary sources have the result that history is usually taught in schools using secondary sources .
contexts.title: Primary source

ml.tokens.model_text: How primary sources are used in history?

messages.original_text: In the study of history as an academic discipline, primary sources can include artifacts, documents, diaries, manuscripts, autobiographies, recordings, or any other source of information that was created at the time under study. They serve as original sources of information about the topic. Examples of primary sources in history include novels or plays, photographs, newsreels, coins, paintings, buildings, archaeological artifacts, oral reports, and interviews. Written sources may be divided into three types: documents such as official reports, speeches, pamphlets, posters, or letters by participants, official election returns, and eyewitness accounts; books, essays, and letters written by intellectuals; and religious texts and descriptions of religious ceremonies and rituals.

messages.speaker: agent
messages.text: The archaeological discoveries helped to shaped the way European colonialists identified with the artifacts and the ancient people who made them . For instance, colonial Europe 's mission in Egypt was able to bring the glory and magnificence of ancient Egypt closer to Europe and incorporate it into knowledge of world history , putting that country  new spotlight . With the archaeological discoveries , ancient Egypt was adopted into the Western historical narrative and came to take on a significance that had up until that time been reserved for ancient Greek and Roman civilization . Also  , historians of the pre-Columbian period mainly interpreted the records of the European conquerors and the accounts of early European travelers and antiquaries .

contexts.text:
Repatriation (cultural heritage)
As further justification for colonial rule , the archaeological discoveries also shaped the way European colonialists identified with the artifacts and the ancient people who made them . In the case of Egypt , colonial Europe 's mission to bring the glory and magnificence of ancient Egypt closer to Europe and incorporate it into knowledge of world history , or better yet , European history placed ancient Egypt in a new spotlight . With the archaeological discoveries , ancient Egypt was adopted into the Western historical narrative and came to take on a significance that had up until that time been reserved for ancient Greek and Roman civilization . The French revolutionaries justified the large - scale and systematic looting of Italy in 1796 by viewing themselves as the political successors of Rome , in the same way that ancient Romans saw themselves as the heirs of Greek civilization ; by the same token , the appropriation of ancient Egyptian history as European history further legitimated Western colonial rule over Egypt . But while ancient Egypt became patrimony of the West , modern Egypt remained a part of the Muslim world . The writings of European archaeologists and tourists illustrate the impression that modern Egyptians were uncivilized , savage , and the antithesis of the splendor of ancient Egypt .
contexts.title: Repatriation (cultural heritage)

ml.tokens.model_text: archaeological sources

contexts.text:
Pre-Columbian era
Before the development of archaeology in the 19th century , historians of the pre-Columbian period mainly interpreted the records of the European conquerors and the accounts of early European travelers and antiquaries . It was not until the nineteenth century that the work of men such as John Lloyd Stephens , Eduard Seler and Alfred P. Maudslay , and of institutions such as the Peabody Museum of Archaeology and Ethnology of Harvard University , led to the reconsideration and criticism of the European sources . Now , the scholarly study of pre-Columbian cultures is most often based on scientific and multidisciplinary methodologies .
contexts.title: Pre-Columbian era

ml.tokens.model_text: archaeological discoveries and colonialists

messages.original_text: Archaeological discoveries can provide valuable insights into colonial history. These discoveries often include artifacts and structures left behind by colonial powers, which can shed light on their ways of life, culture, and interactions with local populations. Additionally, archaeological studies can also uncover evidence of the impact of colonialism on indigenous communities, including changes in settlement patterns, material culture, and social organization. By examining these primary sources, historians can gain a more nuanced understanding of colonial history and its enduring legacies.

messages.speaker: agent
messages.text: Archaeological discoveries suggests that the pre-Roman Celtic societies were linked to the network of overland trade routes that spanned Eurasia but scholars assumed that the original land of the Celts was west of the Rhine , more precisely in Gaul , because it was where Greek and Roman ancient sources , namely Caesar , located the Celts . This view was challenged by the 19th - century historian Marie Henri d'Arbois de Jubainville who placed the land of origin of the Celts east of the Rhine.  Jubainville based his arguments on a phrase of Herodotus ' that placed the Celts at the source of the Danube , and argued that Herodotus had meant to place the Celtic homeland in southern Germany . The finding of the prehistoric cemetery of Hallstat in 1846 by Johan Ramsauer and the finding of the archaeological site of La Tène by Hansli Kopp in 1857 drew attention to this area. Archaeologists have also discovered large prehistoric trackways crossing bogs in Ireland and Germany . As the territory held by the Celts contained tin , lead , iron , silver and gold , they were metalworkers that created weapons and jewellery for international trade , particularly with the Romans .

It serves as an original source of information about the topic . Similar definitions can be used in library science , and other areas of scholarship , although different fields have somewhat different definitions . In journalism , a primary source can be a person with direct knowledge of a situation , or a document written by such a person .

contexts.text:
Celts
Archaeological evidence suggests that the pre-Roman Celtic societies were linked to the network of overland trade routes that spanned Eurasia . Archaeologists have discovered large prehistoric trackways crossing bogs in Ireland and Germany . Due to their substantial nature , these are believed to have been created for wheeled transport as part of an extensive roadway system that facilitated trade . The territory held by the Celts contained tin , lead , iron , silver and gold . Celtic smiths and metalworkers created weapons and jewellery for international trade , particularly with the Romans .
contexts.title: Celts

ml.tokens.model_text: "Celts archaeology

contexts.text:
Celts
Before the 19th century , scholars assumed that the original land of the Celts was west of the Rhine , more precisely in Gaul , because it was where Greek and Roman ancient sources , namely Caesar , located the Celts . This view was challenged by the 19th - century historian Marie Henri d'Arbois de Jubainville who placed the land of origin of the Celts east of the Rhine . Jubainville based his arguments on a phrase of Herodotus ' that placed the Celts at the source of the Danube , and argued that Herodotus had meant to place the Celtic homeland in southern Germany . The finding of the prehistoric cemetery of Hallstat in 1846 by Johan Ramsauer and the finding of the archaeological site of La Tène by Hansli Kopp in 1857 drew attention to this area .
contexts.title: Celts

ml.tokens.model_text: "Celts archaeology

messages.original_text:
The term "Celts" is used in archaeology and linguistics to refer to a group of people in Iron Age and Roman era Europe who spoke Celtic languages and shared certain cultural similarities. However, the term "Celts" is not used in a strict ethnic sense, as there is no clear genetic or cultural continuity between the Iron Age Celts and modern populations who identify as Celts. Archaeological discoveries, such as the Hallstatt and La Tène cultures, have helped to shape our understanding of the Celts and their culture. However, it's important to note that the Celts did not leave behind extensive written records, so much of what we know about them comes from the accounts of ancient Greek and Roman writers, which should be approached with caution as they can be biased.
Regarding the colonialists, archaeological discoveries of Celtic artifacts and remains allowed colonial Europe to adopt the ancient Celtic civilization into the Western historical narrative and gave them a new appreciation for the culture and history of the people they were colonizing.
If you have any specific question about the Celts, please let me know.
Regarding your question about the Celts, I do not have specific information on how the Celts viewed themselves or their religion. However, it is known that the Celts did not leave behind extensive written records, so much of what we know about them comes from the accounts of ancient Greek and Roman writers, which should be approached with caution as they can be biased. The Celts are believed to have practiced a form of polytheism, with a large number of deities, many of which were associated with natural features such as rivers and springs. They are also known to have practiced human sacrifice, although this was likely limited to certain special occasions. The Celts are also known for their art, which is highly distinctive and often features intricate geometric patterns and stylized representations of animals and humans.

messages.speaker: user
messages.text: Talking about the Celts, what is the importance of them in history?

messages.speaker: agent
messages.text: Besides those areas of trade  that was mentioned before, the Celts were were considered a Central European Iron Age phenomenon , through the cultures of Hallstatt and La Tène . The Celtic languages were also important to form  a branch of the larger Indo - European family . By the time speakers of Celtic languages entered history around 400 BC , they were already split into several language groups , and spread over much of Western continental Europe , the Iberian Peninsula , Ireland and Britain . They depict a pre-Christian Iron Age Celtic social structure based formally on class and kingship , although this may only have been a particular late phase of organization in Celtic societies . It is also important to note that the Celts depict a pre-Christian Iron Age Celtic social structure based formally on class and kingship , although this may only have been a particular late phase of organization in Celtic societies .

Similar definitions can be used in library science , and other areas of scholarship , although different fields have somewhat different definitions . In journalism , a primary source can be a person with direct knowledge of a situation , or a document written by such a person .

contexts.text:
Primary source
In scientific literature , a primary source is the original publication of a scientist 's new data , results and theories . In political history , primary sources are documents such as official reports , speeches , pamphlets , posters , or letters by participants , official election returns and eyewitness accounts . In the history of ideas or intellectual history , the main primary sources are books , essays and letters written by intellectuals ; these intellectuals may include historians , whose books and essays are therefore considered primary sources for the intellectual historian , though they are secondary sources in their own topical fields . In religious history , the primary sources are religious texts and descriptions of religious ceremonies and rituals .
contexts.title: Primary source

contexts.text:
Celts
In various academic disciplines the Celts were considered a Central European Iron Age phenomenon , through the cultures of Hallstatt and La Tène . However , archaeological finds from the Halstatt and La Tène culture were rare in the Iberian Peninsula , in southwestern France , northern and western Britain , southern Ireland and Galatia and did not provide enough evidence for a cultural scenario comparable to that of Central Europe . It is considered equally difficult to maintain that the origin of the Peninsular Celts can be linked to the preceding Urnfield culture . This has resulted in a more recent approach that introduces a ' proto - Celtic ' substratum and a process of Celticisation , having its initial roots in the Bronze Age Bell Beaker culture .
contexts.title: Celts

ml.tokens.model_text: what is the importance of the Celts in history?

contexts.text:
Celts
Like other European Iron Age tribal societies , the Celts practised a polytheistic religion . Many Celtic gods are known from texts and inscriptions from the Roman period . Rites and sacrifices were carried out by priests known as druids . The Celts did not see their gods as having human shapes until late in the Iron Age . Celtic shrines were situated in remote areas such as hilltops , groves , and lakes .
contexts.title: Celts

ml.tokens.model_text: what is the importance of the Celts in history?

contexts.text:
Celts
The Celtic languages form a branch of the larger Indo - European family . By the time speakers of Celtic languages entered history around 400 BC , they were already split into several language groups , and spread over much of Western continental Europe , the Iberian Peninsula , Ireland and Britain . The Greek historian Ephorus of Cyme in Asia Minor , writing in the 4th century BC , believed that the Celts came from the islands off the mouth of the Rhine and were `` driven from their homes by the frequency of wars and the violent rising of the sea '' .
contexts.title: Celts

ml.tokens.model_text: what is the importance of the Celts in history?

contexts.text:
Celts
To the extent that sources are available , they depict a pre-Christian Iron Age Celtic social structure based formally on class and kingship , although this may only have been a particular late phase of organization in Celtic societies . Patron - client relationships similar to those of Roman society are also described by Caesar and others in the Gaul of the 1st century BC .
contexts.title: Celts

ml.tokens.model_text: what is the importance of the Celts in history?

contexts.text:
Primary source
In many fields and contexts , such as historical writing , it is almost always advisable to use primary sources if possible , and `` if none are available , it is only with great caution that ( the author ) may proceed to make use of secondary sources . '' In addition , primary sources avoid the problem inherent in secondary sources in which each new author may distort and put a new spin on the findings of prior cited authors .
contexts.title: Primary source

contexts.text:
Primary source
In scholarly writing , an important objective of classifying sources is to determine their independence and reliability . In contexts such as historical writing , it is almost always advisable to use primary sources and that `` if none are available , it is only with great caution that ( the author ) may proceed to make use of secondary sources . '' Sreedharan believes that primary sources have the most direct connection to the past and that they `` speak for themselves '' in ways that can not be captured through the filter of secondary sources .
contexts.title: Primary source

ml.tokens.model_text: Going back to primary source, can it be use in literature

contexts.text:
Primary source
In scholarly writing , the objective of classifying sources is to determine the independence and reliability of sources . Though the terms primary source and secondary source originated in historiography as a way to trace the history of historical ideas , they have been applied to many other fields . For example , these ideas may be used to trace the history of scientific theories , literary elements and other information that is passed from one author to another .
contexts.title: Primary source

ml.tokens.model_text: Going back to primary source, can it be use in literature

contexts.text:
Primary source
In the humanities , a primary source could be defined as something that was created either during the time period being studied or afterward by individuals reflecting on their involvement in the events of that time . In the social sciences , the definition of a primary source would be expanded to include numerical data that has been gathered to analyze relationships between people , events , and their environment . In the natural sciences , a primary source could be defined as a report of original findings or ideas . These sources often appear in the form of research articles with sections on methods and results . ''
contexts.title: Primary source

ml.tokens.model_text: Going back to primary source, can it be use in literature

messages.original_text: The Celts played an important role in history, particularly in the areas of trade and culture. Archaeological discoveries suggest that pre-Roman Celtic societies were linked to the network of overland trade routes that spanned Eurasia. They were skilled metalworkers who created weapons and jewelry for international trade, particularly with the Romans. Additionally, the Celts had a significant impact on the cultural history of various regions in Europe, with their language, religion, and customs influencing the development of many modern European cultures. Despite this, much of what we know about the Celts comes from archaeological findings, as ancient Greek and Roman sources located the Celts in specific regions, which has been a subject of debate among scholars.

messages.speaker: user
messages.text: Going back to primary source, can it be used in literature

messages.text: Yes.  Primary source can be used in the study of cultural history like fictional sources such as novels or plays as well  scholarly writing. contexts.text:
Primary source
In the study of history as an academic discipline , a primary source ( also called original source or evidence ) is an artifact , a document , diary , manuscript , autobiography , a recording , or any other source of information that was created at the time under study . It serves as an original source of information about the topic . Similar definitions can be used in library science , and other areas of scholarship , although different fields have somewhat different definitions . In journalism , a primary source can be a person with direct knowledge of a situation , or a document written by such a person .
contexts.title: Primary source

contexts.text:
Primary source
If a historical text discusses old documents to derive a new historical conclusion , it is considered to be a primary source for the new conclusion . Examples in which a source can be both primary and secondary include an obituary or a survey of several volumes of a journal counting the frequency of articles on a certain topic .
contexts.title: Primary source

ml.tokens.model_text: primary source in literature

messages.original_text: Yes, in the study of cultural history, primary sources can include fictional sources such as novels or plays. These sources provide firsthand insight into the culture, society, and values of the time period in which they were created. They can offer valuable information about the experiences, perspectives, and beliefs of the people who lived during that time. Other examples of primary sources in literature include letters, diaries, and manuscripts written by authors or their contemporaries. These sources can offer unique insights into the creative process, the literary context, and the reception of literary works.

messages.speaker: agent
messages.text: It is important to note the primary sources are distinguished from secondary sources , which cite , comment on , or build upon primary sources .Normally, accounts written after the fact with the benefit ( and possible distortions ) of hindsight are secondary . A secondary source  interprets or analyzes primary sources. Also be a primary source depending on how it is used . For example , a memoir would be considered a primary source in research concerning its author or about his or her friends characterized within it , but the same memoir would be a secondary source if it were used to examine the culture in which its author lived. Both sources should b e be understood as relative terms , with sources categorized according to specific historical contexts and what is being studied . For instance, Documentary films can be considered a secondary source or primary source , depending on how much the filmmaker modifies the original sources depending upon the present state of knowledge within the field .

contexts.text:
Primary source
In the study of history as an academic discipline , a primary source ( also called original source or evidence ) is an artifact , a document , diary , manuscript , autobiography , a recording , or any other source of information that was created at the time under study . It serves as an original source of information about the topic . Similar definitions can be used in library science , and other areas of scholarship , although different fields have somewhat different definitions . In journalism , a primary source can be a person with direct knowledge of a situation , or a document written by such a person .
contexts.title: Primary source

|user|: secondary source

contexts.text:
Primary source
In scientific literature , a primary source is the original publication of a scientist 's new data , results and theories . In political history , primary sources are documents such as official reports , speeches , pamphlets , posters , or letters by participants , official election returns and eyewitness accounts . In the history of ideas or intellectual history , the main primary sources are books , essays and letters written by intellectuals ; these intellectuals may include historians , whose books and essays are therefore considered primary sources for the intellectual historian , though they are secondary sources in their own topical fields . In religious history , the primary sources are religious texts and descriptions of religious ceremonies and rituals .
contexts.title: Primary source

|user|: secondary source

contexts.text:
Primary source
Primary sources are distinguished from secondary sources , which cite , comment on , or build upon primary sources . Generally , accounts written after the fact with the benefit ( and possible distortions ) of hindsight are secondary . A secondary source may also be a primary source depending on how it is used . For example , a memoir would be considered a primary source in research concerning its author or about his or her friends characterized within it , but the same memoir would be a secondary source if it were used to examine the culture in which its author lived . `` Primary '' and `` secondary '' should be understood as relative terms , with sources categorized according to specific historical contexts and what is being studied .
contexts.title: Primary source

ml.tokens.model_text: secondary source

contexts.text:
Primary source
In historiography , when the study of history is subject to historical scrutiny , a secondary source becomes a primary source . For a biography of a historian , that historian 's publications would be primary sources . Documentary films can be considered a secondary source or primary source , depending on how much the filmmaker modifies the original sources .
contexts.title: Primary source

ml.tokens.model_text: What is a Secondary source

contexts.text:
Primary source
Whether a source is regarded as primary or secondary in a given context may change , depending upon the present state of knowledge within the field . For example , if a document refers to the contents of a previous but undiscovered letter , that document may be considered `` primary '' , since it is the closest known thing to an original source ; but if the letter is later found , it may then be considered `` secondary ''
contexts.title: Primary source

ml.tokens.model_text: What is a Secondary source

contexts.text:
Primary source
However , a primary source is not necessarily more of an authority or better than a secondary source . There can be bias and tacit unconscious views which twist historical information .
contexts.title: Primary source

ml.tokens.model_text: What is a Secondary source

messages.original_text: A secondary source is a source that interprets or analyzes primary sources. These sources are one step removed from the event or phenomenon under study. Examples of secondary sources include scholarly articles, textbooks, and encyclopedias that summarize and interpret primary sources. Secondary sources often provide context, background information, and analysis that can help to deepen understanding of the primary sources. In contrast to primary sources, which are original documents or objects from the time period under study, secondary sources are created later and offer an interpretation or explanation of those primary sources.
